Authors:
Chuner Cai, Lingke Wang, Lingjie Zhou, Peimin He, Binghua
Jiao
Title:
Complete chloroplast genome of green tide algae Ulva flexuosa
(Ulvophyceae, Chlorophyta) with comparative analysis
Keywords: chloroplast genome; green tide; Ulva flexuosa
Abstract:
Ulva flexuosa, one kind of green tide algae, has outbroken
in the Yellow Sea of China during the past ten years. In the present
study, we sequenced the chloroplast genome of U. flexuosa followed by
annotation and comparative analysis. It indicated that the chloroplast
genomes had high conservation among Ulva spp., and high rearrangement
outside them. Though U. flexuosa was closer to U. linza than U. fasciata
in phylogenetic tree, the average Ka/Ks between U. flexuosa and U. linza
assessed by 67 protein-coding genes was higher than those between U.
flexuosa and other species in Ulva spp., due to the variation of psbZ,
psbM and ycf20. Our results laid the foundation for the future studies
on the evolution of chloroplast genomes of Ulva, as well as the
molecular identification of U. flexuosa varieties.
